thread.title: TV | Wall Street

author: Jason Brennan
title: TV | Wall Street
text: We know it's a late one, but it's perfectly timed so that you can slip out of the pub before things start to get messy. Your reward? Charlie Sheen at his very best. Having just come off the back of Ferris Bueller's Day Off, and Platoon, Sheen was on a roll before taking this role which sees him play a young Wall Street stock broker who gets corrupted by the pressures of the job and turns to trading on insider information. Look, Martin Sheen plays Charlie's da in it, and any film that makes a real life father and son reprise that relationship on screen is fine by us.
